explanation: SUM adds a range of numbers. =SUM(A1:A10) adds cells A1 through A10.
AVERAGE calculates arithmetic mean. =AVERAGE(A1:A10) gives average of range.
COUNT counts cells containing numbers. COUNTA counts non-empty cells.
MAX returns largest number in range. MIN returns smallest.
IF(condition, value_if_true, value_if_false) - conditional logic.
HLOOKUP searches horizontally in top row. VLOOKUP searches vertically in first column.
CONCATENATE or & joins text. =A1&B1 or =CONCATENATE(A1,B1).
Pivot Table summarizes large data - group, count, sum. Powerful analysis tool.

prompt: Ctrl + F in most applications does?
explanation: Ctrl + F opens Find - search for text in document or page.
Ctrl + H opens Find and Replace - search and substitute text.
Ctrl + X cuts (copies and removes) selected content.
Ctrl + V pastes content from clipboard.
Ctrl + N creates new document, file, or tab.
Ctrl + O opens file open dialog.
Ctrl + W closes current tab or window.
Alt + Tab switches between open windows/applications.
PrtScn captures screen. Alt+PrtScn captures active window. Paste in Paint/Word.
Caps Lock toggles letter keys between uppercase and lowercase.
Num Lock enables/disables numeric keypad. When off, keys act as arrow keys.

answers: Tool to find information on web - Google, Bing
explanation: Search engines index web - Google, Bing, Yahoo. Search by keywords.
URL starts with protocol: http:// or https://. Then domain name.
.edu is for educational institutions (US). .ac.in for Indian academics.
.gov is for government websites. .gov.in for Indian government.
.org often used by non-profits, organizations. Not strictly enforced.
BCC recipients are hidden from other recipients. Used for privacy.
